subject: Re: [junit] RE: Transactions in *unit
msgSnippet: ... Although I have advocated that procedure a few times, I have run into a caveat recently: To do it effectly the database and/or persistence framework in use
messageBody:
Kevin Bourrillion wrote:

> Or do you just start a transaction during setUp() and then roll it back
> during tearDown(), thus magically taking care of all your cleanup?
>
> Kevin

Although I have advocated that procedure a few times, I have run into a caveat
recently:
To do it effectly the database and/or persistence framework in use must be able
to handle nested transactions. However, the way that nested transactions work
differs from db to db and from framework to framework, e.g. some changes to the
data might only be visible once they have been committed by the outermost
transaction. Those subtleties can make it a very difficult task to do it always
the way Kevin describes. This is just one more argument for providing a
mockable abstraction to your persistent data layer and to use the mock in as
many tests as possible.

Johannes
